marketNews.title: Property Marketing Sales Compilation 1H25
marketNews.content:
Several residential property issuers have announced their marketing sales realizations for the first half of 2025, including Ciputra Development (CTRA), Summarecon Agung (SMRA), and Pakuwon Jati (PWON) [see table].

CTRA recorded the highest realization against its marketing sales target (52%). The relatively good 1H25 performance of CTRA was supported by the launch of a new cluster contributing approximately 54% to total marketing sales in 2Q25. Meanwhile, SMRA recorded a high 1H25 marketing sales growth (+42% YoY), resulting in a better realization against the marketing sales target (43%) compared to last year (1H24: 34% against target).

The 1H25 marketing sales achievement was also driven by a 100% value-added tax (VAT) incentive (PPN DTP) borne by the government. During 1H25, PWON was the issuer with the highest contribution of the VAT incentive to marketing sales, where 75% of the company's total realized marketing sales came from products eligible for the incentive. Meanwhile, SMRA has not released data on the contribution of the VAT incentive. However, in 1H24, the contribution of products eligible for the incentive reached 61% of SMRA's marketing sales.

The 100% VAT incentive ends in June 2025. For the period July-December 2025, the incentive will be reduced to 50%.

Key Takeaway

In general, the realization of marketing sales in the second half of 2025 may be more challenging as the incentive amount declines, requiring other positive catalysts to support sales. On the other hand, investors should monitor the Bank Indonesia interest rate decision on Wednesday (16/7). Of the 33 economists surveyed by Bloomberg, 18 expect a rate cut, while the remainder expect the rate to be maintained. Although the positive impact of a rate cut on sales is considered limited, a rate cut could still provide positive sentiment for property stocks.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. The National Bureau of Statistics of China reported that China's economy grew +5.2% YoY in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: +5.4% YoY), beating the consensus estimate of +5.1% YoY. The growth was driven by strong exports to markets outside the United States, while domestic consumer demand remained weak.
2. BPJS Kesehatan Director General Ghufron Mukti said that the Coordination of Benefits (CoB) scheme is now available to BPJS Kesehatan participants. The scheme applies to class 1 and class 2 participants and aims to maximize health insurance benefits for members who have both BPJS and additional private health insurance.
3. Bloomberg reported that Indonesia's Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia stated Indonesia will only proceed with a planned US oil-related product purchase worth USD 10-15 billion if the United States reduces tariffs for Indonesia. Previously, Indonesia had offered up to USD 15.5 billion for US energy products to reduce the trade surplus and obtain lower tariffs.
4. Perum Bulog announced that it will involve village/kelurahan cooperatives (kopdes/kel) Red and White as partners for the distribution of stabilized rice supply and food price stabilization (SPHP). Bulog's CEO Ahmad Rizal Ramdhani said the cooperatives can submit the amount of rice needed to the local Bulog office. In addition to SPHP rice, the cooperatives will also distribute products from ID Food and Pertamina.
5. Housing and Settlement Affairs Minister Maruarar Sirait said on Monday (14/7) that technical regulations for the disbursement of People's Business Credit (KUR) for the housing sector, amounting to IDR 130 trillion, are under discussion and will be issued as a Ministerial Decree expected at the end of July 2025. Previously, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto disclosed that the KUR housing ceiling would be raised to IDR 5 billion for UMKM contractors building 36-square-meter houses.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Secures New Contract Worth IDR 3.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Petrosea announced that it has signed a service contract for stripping and relocating cover layers with PT Barasentosa Lestari (BSL) in Musi Rawas Utara Regency, South Sumatra Province. The contract has a duration of 5 years with an estimated contract value of approximately IDR 3.5 trillion. BSL is a business entity of Golden Energy Mines (GEMS).

tickerNews.title: Barito Pacific Clarifies No IPO Plans for Griya Idola and Unnamed Gold Mining Company
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific Group, represented by Angelin Sumendap, told Katadata that PT Griya Idola and an unnamed gold mining company have no plans for an IPO. Both companies are currently focusing on implementing their business development strategies. The clarification was made after reports that the two companies were preparing for an IPO.

tickerNews.title: INET Plans to Issue Series II Warrants Up to 3.2 Billion Units Alongside Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima announced that it plans to issue Series II Warrants up to 3.2 billion units together with a rights issue of up to 12.8 billion new shares. This implies that for every 4 new shares issued through the rights issue, 1 Series II warrant will be attached. The proceeds from the warrant issuance will be used for expansion and business development in the telecommunications sector. The warrant issuance plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders on 20 August 2025. Previously, INET obtained approval to carry out a rights issue of up to 12.8 billion new shares at the Extraordinary General Meeting on 12 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Shareholder Harimas Tunggal Perkasa Increases Stake to 45.84%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Impack Pratama Industri, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, purchased approximately 392 million IMPC shares at an average price of IDR 300 per share between 10-15 July 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 118 billion. After this transaction, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa’s ownership in IMPC increased from 45.11% to 45.84%.

tickerNews.title: Krakatau Steel Prepares 200-Hectare Industrial Estate Development in Cilegon
tickerNews.content: Krakatau Steel’s Chief Financial Officer and Risk Management Director, Daniel Fitzgerald Liman, stated that the company is preparing an industrial estate development project in Cilegon utilizing 200 hectares of undeveloped land. The project will focus on building a steel-based industrial ecosystem, which is expected to become a key benchmark for Krakatau Steel’s future revival. Daniel added that the project could attract investor interest and create monetisation opportunities, while remaining aimed at supporting the downstream national steel industry.
